ygData.subject: Re: Staff of the Wheel
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow, talk about misunderstandings. Jason Smith misunderstood and thought there are IBS in Guk. You misunderstood and thought he s talking about everfrost. :)
ygData.messageBody:
Wow, talk about misunderstandings. Jason Smith misunderstood and thought
there are IBS in Guk. You misunderstood and thought he's talking about
everfrost. :)

Joe Wallace wrote:
>
> From: "Joe Wallace" <joew88@...>
>
> They must have changed the quest then, at least the part that surrounds this
> rod. When I began the quest, it was shortly after the patch put the quest
> in place, and the rod in Everfrost was the first one I got. I just got a
> druid to cast enduring breath on me, and then I went invis and had
> absolutely no trouble finding the rod. I saw the NPC, and my invis did wear
> off, but not while I was around him. The majority of the tunnels down
> there were totally empty, so I had no trouble refreshing my invis. The rod
> itself was inside a smaller room with a ramp leading in, and was indeed
> surrounded by 3 ice bone skeletons, all of which conned green to me at level
> 29 when I went to get the rod. They see through invis, of course, and
> attacked the minute I took the rod. Nevertheless, they were insignificant
> enough that I had absolutely no trouble gating even with them attempting to
> hit me. I figured that this rod was one of the easiest to obtain. But
> again, this was right after the quest was put in. They may have made it
> more difficult since.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Jason Smith <jj@...>
> To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Friday, October 29, 1999 9:31 AM
> Subject: RE: [eq_wizards] Staff of the Wheel
>
> > From: "Jason Smith" <jj@...>
> >
> > It would be a suicide run, I was down there with a group of 45ish players
> > when I got my rod. Very doubtful you could navigate and retain you invis
> to
> > the room and back. Even if you tried to gate out, you would be dead VERY
> > fast! ;o) Best choice to is find a higher level friend to help you get
> down
> > to it, and I never saw any Ice Bone Skeletons in that area.
> > Zebbi
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Alan Charity [mailto:acharity@...]
> > Sent: Friday, October 29, 1999 7:45 AM
> > To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> > Subject: [eq_wizards] Staff of the Wheel
> >
> >
> > From: "Alan Charity" <acharity@...>
> >
> > I have started my quest for the Staff of the Wheel and currently have 8 of
> > the 10 rods.
> >
> >
> > I am missing the one in Guk and the one from the Everfrost caves. But I
> have
> > a few questions since I have spent no time in Guk in 32 levels.
> >
> > GUK
> > 1. I need to know the easiest or quickest path to the hand room?
> >
> >
> > 2. Is the room on the Live or Dead side?
> >
> >
> > 3. Will I encounter any Undead frogs along the way?
> >
> >
> > EVERFROST
> > I know that the rod is surrounded by 3 IBS and that an NPC is in the area.
> I
> > can get by the IBS with Invis to Undead but the NPC could be a problem.
> >
> > 1. Is this NPC within range of the rod?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > I will not have a group with me and am only going to attempt this when the
> > Hand room is being camped. I may however try a suicide run depending on
> how
> > brave I feel.
> >
> > Aljernon
> > 32nd Level Wizard
> >
> > >
>
>
--
Sergey

Worker bees can leave
Even drones can fly away
The queen is their slave
